turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: Thanks. I thought I was gonna have to go to the hospital.

turns.speaker: DANTE
turns.text: I'll throw this out. Precautionary measure.

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: It stings a little.

turns.speaker: DANTE
turns.text: A word of advice: Sometimes it's best to let those hard to reach chips go.

turns.speaker: SUITED MAN
turns.text: You open?

turns.speaker: DANTE
turns.text: Yes.  I'm not out of shape.

turns.speaker: SUITED MAN
turns.text: Excuse me, but have you been here all day?

turns.speaker: DANTE
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: SUITED MAN
turns.text: Were you working here at about four o'clock?

turns.speaker: DANTE
turns.text: I've been here since six o'clock this morning. Why?

turns.speaker: DANTE
turns.text: I'm not out of shape!

turns.speaker: SUITED MAN
turns.text: Can I have your name please?

turns.speaker: DANTE
turns.text: Dante Hicks. Why? What is this about?

turns.speaker: SUITED MAN
turns.text: Here you go.

turns.speaker: DANTE
turns.text: What's this?

turns.speaker: SUITED MAN
turns.text: A fine, for five hundred dollars.

turns.speaker: DANTE
turns.text: WHAT?

turns.speaker: DANTE
turns.text: What are you talking about?

turns.speaker: SUITED MAN
turns.text: According to the NJAC-the New Jersey Administrative Code, section eighteen, five, slash twelve point five-a fine of no less than two hundred and fifty dollars is to be leveled against any person reported selling cigarettes to a minor.

turns.speaker: DANTE
turns.text: I didn't do that!

turns.speaker: SUITED MAN
turns.text: You said you were here all day?

turns.speaker: DANTE
turns.text: Yeah, but I didn't sell cigarettes to any kids!

turns.speaker: SUITED MAN
turns.text: An angry mother called the state division of taxation and complained that the man working at Quick Stop Convenience sold her five-year-old daughter cigarettes today at around four o'clock. Division of taxation calls the State Board of Health, and they send me down here to issue a fine. You say you were working all day, hence the fine is yours.  It's doubled due to the incredibly young age of the child.

turns.speaker: DANTE
turns.text: But I didn't sell cigarettes to any kid!

turns.speaker: DANTE
turns.text: I didn't sell cigarettes to any kids! I swear!

turns.speaker: SUITED MAN
turns.text: The due date is on the bottom. This summons cannot be contested in any court of law. Failure to remit before the due date will result in a charge of criminal negligence, and a warrant will be issued for your arrest. Have a nice day.

turns.speaker: JAY
turns.text: Oh shit, look who it is. The human vacuum.

turns.speaker: GIRL 1
turns.text: Scumbag. What are you doing?

turns.speaker: JAY
turns.text: Nothing. Just hanging out with Silent Bob and his cousin.

turns.speaker: GIRL 1
turns.text: He's your cousin?

turns.speaker: JAY
turns.text: Check this out, he's from Russia.

turns.speaker: GIRL 1
turns.text: No way.

turns.speaker: JAY
turns.text: I swear to God. Silent Bob, am I lying?

turns.speaker: GIRL 1
turns.text: He only speaks Russian?

turns.speaker: JAY
turns.text: He knows some English, but he can't not speak it good like we do.

turns.speaker: GIRL 1
turns.text: No way!

turns.speaker: JAY
turns.text: Swear.  Olaf, metal!

turns.speaker: GIRL 1
turns.text: What did he say?

turns.speaker: JAY
turns.text: I don't know, man. He's a fucking character.

turns.speaker: GIRL 1
turns.text: That doesn't sound metal.

turns.speaker: JAY
turns.text: You gotta hear him sing.  Olaf, "Berserker!"

turns.speaker: GIRL 1
turns.text: Did he say "making fuck?"

turns.speaker: JAY
turns.text: Wait, there's more.  Olaf: sing...

turns.speaker: GIRL 2
turns.text: What part of Russia?

turns.speaker: JAY
turns.text: I don't fucking know. What am I, his biographer?  Olaf, what part of Russia are you from?

turns.speaker: GIRL 2
turns.text: Is he staying here?

turns.speaker: JAY
turns.text: He's moving to the big city next week. He wants to be a metal singer.

turns.speaker: GIRL 2
turns.text: He really wants to play metal?

turns.speaker: JAY
turns.text: He's got his own band in Moscow. It's called "Fuck Your Yankee Blue Jeans" or something like that.

turns.speaker: JAY
turns.text: Come on, man, "Berserker!"

turns.speaker: GIRL 2
turns.text: Does he sing in English or Russian?

turns.speaker: JAY
turns.text: English.  Come on, "Berserker!" Girls think sexy.

turns.speaker: TRAINER
turns.text: Let me ask you a question: Do you think this guy's out of shape?

turns.speaker: HEATHER
turns.text: I don't know. I can't really tell from here.

turns.speaker: TRAINER
turns.text: He is.

turns.speaker: TRAINER
turns.text: I think the lady called it.

turns.speaker: HEATHER
turns.text: My ex-boyfriend was about his height, but he was much bulkier. He could bench two-fifty, three hundred easy.

turns.speaker: TRAINER
turns.text: I do about three-fifty, four.

turns.speaker: HEATHER
turns.text: No way!

turns.speaker: TRAINER
turns.text: Feel that.

turns.speaker: HEATHER
turns.text: That's tight. Solid.

turns.speaker: TRAINER
turns.text: Now feel his.  Roll up your sleeve, chief.

turns.speaker: TRAINER
turns.text: It's probably from being around all this food every day.

turns.speaker: HEATHER
turns.text: Oh, I know. If I had to work here all day, I'd be bloated and out of shape, too.

turns.speaker: HEATHER
turns.text: You're Dante Hicks? Oh my God! I didn't even recognize you!

turns.speaker: TRAINER
turns.text: Because he's out of shape.

turns.speaker: HEATHER
turns.text: To an Asian design major.

turns.speaker: TRAINER
turns.text: Shit!  Don't take this the wrong way, but I used to fuck her.

turns.speaker: HEATHER
turns.text: Oh my God! You're Rick Derris?

turns.speaker: TRAINER
turns.text: Yeah!

turns.speaker: TRAINER
turns.text: Really?

turns.speaker: HEATHER
turns.text: Oh yeah. You were the built older guy with the black Trans and the big...

turns.speaker: TRAINER
turns.text: Holy shit! She told you about that!  Buddy of mine worked there. Said he watched the whole thing. They used to film people at that hotel; nobody knew about it.

turns.speaker: HEATHER
turns.text: She said one time you set up a tent on the beach and you guys did it in the middle of this big rainstorm.

turns.speaker: TRAINER
turns.text: To a five-year-old kid? What a scumbag!

turns.speaker: HEATHER
turns.text: That's sick, Dante.

turns.speaker: HEATHER
turns.text: Sure. How about the beach?

turns.speaker: TRAINER
turns.text: I like the way you think.

turns.speaker: INDECISIVE CUSTOMER
turns.text: You've never heard anybody say anything about either movie?

turns.speaker: RANDAL
turns.text: I find it's best to stay out of other people's affairs.

turns.speaker: INDECISIVE CUSTOMER
turns.text: Well, how about these two movies?

turns.speaker: INDECISIVE CUSTOMER
turns.text: I just held up the same two movies. You're not even paying attention.

turns.speaker: RANDAL
turns.text: No, I wasn't.

turns.speaker: INDECISIVE CUSTOMER
turns.text: I don't think your manager would appreciate...

turns.speaker: RANDAL
turns.text: I don't appreciate your ruse, ma'am.

turns.speaker: INDECISIVE CUSTOMER
turns.text: I beg your pardon!

turns.speaker: RANDAL
turns.text: Your ruse. Your cunning attempt to trick me.

turns.speaker: INDECISIVE CUSTOMER
turns.text: I only pointed out that you weren't paying any attention to what I was saying.

turns.speaker: RANDAL
turns.text: I hope it feels good.

turns.speaker: INDECISIVE CUSTOMER
turns.text: You hope what feels good?

turns.speaker: RANDAL
turns.text: I hope it feels so good to be right. There is nothing more exhilarating than pointing out the shortcomings of others, is there?

turns.speaker: INDECISIVE CUSTOMER
turns.text: Well this is the last time I ever rent here...

turns.speaker: RANDAL
turns.text: You'll be missed.

turns.speaker: INDECISIVE CUSTOMER
turns.text: Screw you!

turns.speaker: JAY
turns.text: That's the price, my brother.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Yo, I don't have that kind of cash.

turns.speaker: JAY
turns.text: For this kind of hash, you need that kind of cash.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: How long you gonna be here?

turns.speaker: JAY
turns.text: Till ten. Then I'm going to John K's party.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: You're gonna be at John K's party?

turns.speaker: JAY
turns.text: My man is deaf.  I'M GOING TO JOHN K'S PARTY!  Neh.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Yo, don't sell all that. 'Cause I'm gonna get the cash and buy it from you at John K's. You're gonna bring it, right?

turns.speaker: JAY
turns.text: The only place I don't bring my drugs is church. And that ain't till Sunday morning.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Yo. I'll see you at that party.  I'll see you there?

turns.speaker: JAY
turns.text: I'll see you there.

turns.speaker: VERONICA
turns.text: And... he told you all of this?

turns.speaker: RANDAL
turns.text: Pretty much. All except the latent homosexuality part-that's just my theory.

turns.speaker: VERONICA
turns.text: I... I don't know what to say.

turns.speaker: RANDAL
turns.text: Don't hold it against him. He just never got Caitlin out of his system. It's not your fault. It's Dante.  I don't know thing one about chicks. Do you want to cry or something? I can leave.

turns.speaker: VERONICA
turns.text: I'm not sad.

turns.speaker: RANDAL
turns.text: You're not?

turns.speaker: VERONICA
turns.text: No, I'm more furious. I'm pissed off. I feel like he's been killing time while he tries to grow the balls to tell me how he really feels, and then he can't even do it!  He has his friend do it for him!

turns.speaker: RANDAL
turns.text: He didn't ask me to...

turns.speaker: VERONICA
turns.text: After all that I've done for that fuck! And he wants to be with that slut? Fine! He can have his slut!

turns.speaker: RANDAL
turns.text: Um, do you think you can give me a lift home tonight?

turns.speaker: VERONICA
turns.text: I'm going to have a word with that asshole.

turns.speaker: V.A. CUSTOMER
turns.text: The guy ain't here yet.

turns.speaker: RANDAL
turns.text: You're kidding. It's almost eleven- thirty!

turns.speaker: V.A. CUSTOMER
turns.text: I know. I've been here since eleven.

turns.speaker: RANDAL
turns.text: Man! I hate it when I can't rent videos!

turns.speaker: V.A. CUSTOMER
turns.text: I would've went to Big Choice, but the tape I want is right there on the wall.

turns.speaker: RANDAL
turns.text: Which one?

turns.speaker: V.A. CUSTOMER
turns.text: Dental School.

turns.speaker: RANDAL
turns.text: You came for that too? That's the movie I came for.

turns.speaker: V.A. CUSTOMER
turns.text: I have first dibs.

turns.speaker: RANDAL
turns.text: Says who?

turns.speaker: V.A. CUSTOMER
turns.text: Says me. I've been here for half an hour. I'd call that first dibs.

turns.speaker: RANDAL
turns.text: Ain't gonna happen, my friend. I'm getting that tape.

turns.speaker: V.A. CUSTOMER
turns.text: Like hell you are!

turns.speaker: RANDAL
turns.text: I'll bet you twenty bucks you don't get to rent that tape.

turns.speaker: V.A. CUSTOMER
turns.text: Twenty bucks?

turns.speaker: RANDAL
turns.text: Twenty bucks.

turns.speaker: V.A. CUSTOMER
turns.text: All right, asshole, you're on.

turns.speaker: VERONICA
turns.text: Willam!

turns.speaker: WILLAM
turns.text: Ronnie! How are you? You work here now?

turns.speaker: VERONICA
turns.text: No, I'm just visiting my man.  Dante, this is Willam Black.  This is Dante Hicks, my boyfriend.

turns.speaker: VERONICA
turns.text: No, I transferred into Monmouth this year. I was tired of missing him.

turns.speaker: WILLAM
turns.text: Do you still talk to Sylvan?

turns.speaker: VERONICA
turns.text: I just talked to her on Monday. We still hang out on weekends.

turns.speaker: WILLAM
turns.text: That's cool. Well-you two lovebirds take it easy, all right?

turns.speaker: VERONICA
turns.text: I will. Take it easy.

turns.speaker: WILLAM
turns.text: Bye.

turns.speaker: VERONICA
turns.text: Bye  That was Snowball.

turns.speaker: BRETT
turns.text: Gabe!  Hey, man!  Gabe!  It's Gabe!

turns.speaker: EVAN
turns.text: How yo doin', Gabe!

turns.speaker: BRETT
turns.text: Work!  Don't say that word, man.

turns.speaker: EVAN
turns.text: Man, I hate work even when somebody else does it!

turns.speaker: BRETT
turns.text: Hey, Gabe, we're flyin' off the Tower today.  C'mon with us.

turns.speaker: EVAN
turns.text: C'mon, man--it's perfect weather for a monster, full-fledged gutrush!

turns.speaker: BRETT
turns.text: Did you catch that thunder?

turns.speaker: EVAN
turns.text: No way, death-breath, that was too intense for thunder.  C'mon let's rock an' roll.

turns.speaker: EVAN
turns.text: "It's a perfect day for a monster jump."  Hey man, can you like do me a favor?

turns.speaker: BRETT
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: EVAN
turns.text: Next time you're like watching MTV, y' know, like flip it to the weather channel for a split second and check it out.  I mean, hey, we could be home watching some righteous pornos.

turns.speaker: BRETT
turns.text: That woulda been cool.

turns.speaker: EVAN
turns.text: Exactly, cheesehead, exactly.

turns.speaker: DELMAR
turns.text: Answer the man.

turns.speaker: HAL
turns.text: Nothing, just tourist souvenirs.

turns.speaker: DELMAR
turns.text: More bang for the buck.

turns.speaker: DELMAR
turns.text: Ready to die quiet-like, asshole.

turns.speaker: HAL
turns.text: Hey, let's get something straight. If I'm gonna die, I'm gonna die, but you're always gonna be the asshole, so just shoot, alright.

turns.speaker: DELMAR
turns.text: Who's shooting?

turns.speaker: DELMAR
turns.text: Did I hear somethin' break? Outside left!

turns.speaker: HAL
turns.text: Fuck you.

turns.speaker: DELMAR
turns.text: Cursin'.  That's a penalty kick for unsportsmanlike conduct, mate.

turns.speaker: JESSIE
turns.text: Hal's signalling he's OK.

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: They're about two hundred yards from the top of the tower, right where that ledge comes out, Gabe.

turns.speaker: JESSIE
turns.text: He said the Tower, but he's on Comb Bluff?  Frank, fly me to the west valley, the winds are never too bad there and it's only a half hour climb to the Douglas Shaft.

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: I don't know.

turns.speaker: JESSIE
turns.text: If I don't meet up with them, you can come and pick me up by nightfall.

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: Hal will have my head for this.

turns.speaker: JESSIE
turns.text: And it's such a handsome head. Please Frank, and I swear I'll buy one of your paintings.

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: I admit, I can be bought.

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: Jessie, Jessie, copy?

turns.speaker: JESSIE
turns.text: I copy.

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: Jessie, girl this is insane. Weather stat called in wind gusts up to 50 knots for tonight.

turns.speaker: JESSIE
turns.text: If you can't make it back, I'll hold up at the Douglas Shaft. Stop worryin'.  You sound like a mother hen.

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: Rooster!  Forget the hen stuff. Be safe, honey.  Over.

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: Jessie, Hal, come in...please report.  Over.

turns.speaker: JESSIE
turns.text: Where's the radio?

turns.speaker: HAL
turns.text: Hey, Jessie, you're just in time for another masterpiece.

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: So, what do you see?

turns.speaker: HAL
turns.text: Surprise me.

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: What usually eats a banana?

turns.speaker: HAL
turns.text: A monkey?

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: So...what are you, blind, son? This is a banana eating a monkey, nature in reverse.

turns.speaker: HAL
turns.text: Y'know, Jessie, doesn't Frank look like a normal guy--but he's not,  are you Frank?

turns.speaker: QUALEN
turns.text: That was the first and last question-- now only answers. Where's the chopper?

turns.speaker: GABE
turns.text: It can't fly in this weather.

turns.speaker: QUALEN
turns.text: This is where your background in police work comes in handy--ask the questions, Travers.

turns.speaker: QUALEN
turns.text: You know how the airlines are.

turns.speaker: GABE
turns.text: Bags?

turns.speaker: QUALEN
turns.text: Suits, underwear, 100 million dollars...the usual stuff. Travers was smart enough to bring along a tracking device.  Step into my office.

turns.speaker: GABE
turns.text: Looks like the Tower.  It's a bad climb.

turns.speaker: QUALEN
turns.text: A bad climb, no, just another challenge.  What's life without 'em, right, Agent Travers.

turns.speaker: QUALEN
turns.text: Go on, fetch.

turns.speaker: GABE
turns.text: I need my bolt gun and an ice axe.

turns.speaker: QUALEN
turns.text: Tucker?

turns.speaker: GABE
turns.text: Qualen, glad you stuck around. There should be a few hundred cops looking to meet you.

turns.speaker: GABE
turns.text: Jessie!  Are you alright?

turns.speaker: QUALEN
turns.text: I want the money--meet me at the highest point from where you are. Don't do it and we're going to see if your angel here can fly. Copy?

turns.speaker: GABE
turns.text: Copy.  Jessie, go to the top of Bitker ladder.

turns.speaker: QUALEN
turns.text: Love's a killer, isn't it?

turns.speaker: QUALEN
turns.text: Where are you, Walker?

turns.speaker: GABE
turns.text: You're getting warmer!

turns.speaker: QUALEN
turns.text: Throw it up or I'll kill her.

turns.speaker: GABE
turns.text: You do, and the spring thaw is going to be worth a lot of cash!

turns.speaker: QUALEN
turns.text: The money!

turns.speaker: GABE
turns.text: WHEN SHE'S SAFE!

turns.speaker: HAL
turns.text: Glad you could drop in.

turns.speaker: GABE
turns.text: Hey, anything for a friend. How's the knee?

turns.speaker: HAL
turns.text: I think it's out.  No big deal. It's that old football injury.

turns.speaker: GABE
turns.text: Funny, he told me he twisted it gettin' out of a hot tub.

turns.speaker: HAL
turns.text: I love you, too.

turns.speaker: GABE
turns.text: Rescue One -- have located helpless climber, please prepare <u>idiot line</u> for transport, over.

turns.speaker: HAL
turns.text: Wait 'til you get into trouble, just wait.

turns.speaker: GABE
turns.text: Remember, keep your arms and legs within the vehicle at all times--

turns.speaker: HAL
turns.text: Hey, fuck you.

turns.speaker: GABE
turns.text: I'm coming out!

turns.speaker: HAL
turns.text: No, stay off the line!  You'll break her loose!

turns.speaker: GABE
turns.text: The clip's not gonna hold!

turns.speaker: GABE
turns.text: She's losing it!

turns.speaker: HAL
turns.text: Sarah, hold on, he'll have you in a second.  Jesus Christ, grab her!

turns.speaker: HAL
turns.text: What the hell are you doing here?!

turns.speaker: GABE
turns.text: I was with Jessie, she filled me in.

turns.speaker: HAL
turns.text: Now let me fill you in.  You can get your ass back down an' go back to that hole you been hiding in--

turns.speaker: GABE
turns.text: When we get this group down, I'm gone.

turns.speaker: HAL
turns.text: You're gone now!  I don't climb with people I can't trust.  Why'd you come up, to prove something?

turns.speaker: GABE
turns.text: I'm here for the same reason you are, so let's do it.

turns.speaker: HAL
turns.text: Can't pass up another chance to play hero, can you.

turns.speaker: GABE
turns.text: Look, I know--

turns.speaker: HAL
turns.text: You don't know anything. You did it your way and she died.

turns.speaker: GABE
turns.text: I did what I thought was right.

turns.speaker: HAL
turns.text: Well you were wrong! It was your weight on the line that did it--

turns.speaker: GABE
turns.text: There wasn't time for anything else.

turns.speaker: HAL
turns.text: We'll never know, will we?

turns.speaker: GABE
turns.text: Look, it was a bad time for everybody.

turns.speaker: HAL
turns.text: What the hell do you know about bad time.  You didn't love her, you didn't have to explain to her family.

turns.speaker: GABE
turns.text: And you weren't looking into her eyes when she fell.  Now drop it!

turns.speaker: HAL
turns.text: No, buddy, it was you who dropped it!

turns.speaker: GABE
turns.text: If you want, do it.  I don't care.

turns.speaker: HAL
turns.text: Forget me.  If you can, get away.

turns.speaker: GABE
turns.text: Would you?

turns.speaker: HAL
turns.text: Thanks for staying around when you didn't have to.

turns.speaker: GABE
turns.text: My pleasure.

turns.speaker: GABE
turns.text: How's your leg? I'll live.  Where'd you leave Jessie?

turns.speaker: GABE
turns.text: Near Freedom Falls.  She went for help.

turns.speaker: HAL
turns.text: Hey, about everything that happened with Sarah.  I know you did what you could--

turns.speaker: HAL
turns.text: What are we going to do?

turns.speaker: GABE
turns.text: Give him the money.

turns.speaker: HAL
turns.text: I'm going with you.

turns.speaker: GABE
turns.text: Not on that leg.

turns.speaker: HAL
turns.text: Take the gun.

turns.speaker: GABE
turns.text: You keep it.  Get up there if you can, and if you get a chance, do me a favor and kill him.

turns.speaker: GABE
turns.text: Room service...Hi, Sarah.

turns.speaker: SARAH
turns.text: Hi, Gabe.

turns.speaker: GABE
turns.text: How're ya feeling?

turns.speaker: SARAH
turns.text: Fine, I guess...

turns.speaker: GABE
turns.text: Sarah, we could take off and leave this guy behind...

turns.speaker: GABE
turns.text: She's tough.

turns.speaker: SARAH
turns.text: Is it really four thousand?

turns.speaker: GABE
turns.text: Sarah, tonight why don't you and Hal come over for dinner?

turns.speaker: SARAH
turns.text: Okay--I don't know about this.

turns.speaker: SARAH
turns.text: Please, can I think about this for a minute...Okay, I'm sorry, it's fine.  What do you want me to do?

turns.speaker: GABE
turns.text: Just keep lookin' at me and only think about the distance <u>across</u>. Count it as you go:  One, two...by eight you'll be there.

turns.speaker: SARAH
turns.text: Can I count as fast as I like?

turns.speaker: GABE
turns.text: Sure you can.

turns.speaker: SARAH
turns.text: I'm sorry for all the trouble... Thank you.

turns.speaker: GABE
turns.text: There you go.

turns.speaker: SARAH
turns.text: One...

turns.speaker: SARAH
turns.text: Two...

turns.speaker: GABE
turns.text: That's it, you look like a professional.

turns.speaker: SARAH
turns.text: Three...

turns.speaker: SARAH
turns.text: Four...five...

turns.speaker: GABE
turns.text: Nice and easy...

turns.speaker: SARAH
turns.text: Six...

turns.speaker: SARAH
turns.text: Please -- oh, no -- please!

turns.speaker: GABE
turns.text: I'm here!  Sarah, I'm here!  I'm here--I've got you!

turns.speaker: GABE
turns.text: Use your other hand!  Grab it!

turns.speaker: SARAH
turns.text: Help me!  I don't want to die!

turns.speaker: GABE
turns.text: You're not gonna die.  Grab me with your other hand!

turns.speaker: GABE
turns.text: Do you see them yet?

turns.speaker: JESSIE
turns.text: Patience my love, patience.

turns.speaker: GABE
turns.text: That's a virtue isn't it?

turns.speaker: JESSIE
turns.text: Wait, I think I have them sighted.  What's the word, Frank?

turns.speaker: JESSIE
turns.text: Gabe?  Gabe, where are you?

turns.speaker: GABE
turns.text: Just hangin' out.

turns.speaker: JESSIE
turns.text: Oh, my God!  I can't recognize the face, but the butt does look vaguely familiar.

turns.speaker: GABE
turns.text: Don't say that.  You'll embarrass Frank.

turns.speaker: JESSIE
turns.text: He knows it well.

turns.speaker: GABE
turns.text: The ledge, I know it well, or should I say <u>we</u> know it well.

turns.speaker: JESSIE
turns.text: You can stop right there.

turns.speaker: GABE
turns.text: We spent a night there one night...

turns.speaker: JESSIE
turns.text: Enough.

turns.speaker: GABE
turns.text: Yeah, we were caught in a storm. I went up there an innocent climber...

turns.speaker: JESSIE
turns.text: Oh, please.

turns.speaker: GABE
turns.text: And when I came down, my morals were corrupted forever.

turns.speaker: JESSIE
turns.text: Don't believe it...  You know the trouble with you is you have no brain filter. Everything you think just pours right out.

turns.speaker: JESSIE
turns.text: The winds are picking up.

turns.speaker: GABE
turns.text: On my way.  Alright Sarah, are you ready for the best ride in the park?

turns.speaker: JESSIE
turns.text: Hello, Gabriel.

turns.speaker: GABE
turns.text: When you call me Gabriel, I know I've got trouble.

turns.speaker: JESSIE
turns.text: Where've you been?

turns.speaker: GABE
turns.text: Working...I'm trying to figure out where to start.

turns.speaker: JESSIE
turns.text: Maybe I can help. Let's see... if one night I got up and packed up all my things and drove away without leaving so much as a note, and stayed away for months, I think what I'd want to do is come up with a well thought-out reason.

turns.speaker: GABE
turns.text: After the funeral I just had to leave.

turns.speaker: JESSIE
turns.text: Had to leave?  Believe me, we all wanted to leave...but you know what?  We stayed.

turns.speaker: GABE
turns.text: A lot of things fell apart up there.

turns.speaker: JESSIE
turns.text: I know...

turns.speaker: GABE
turns.text: I don't think you do.

turns.speaker: JESSIE
turns.text: Why can't you believe that you did everything you could?

turns.speaker: GABE
turns.text: Did I?  I don't know.  Maybe I shouldn't have gone out on that line.  Maybe I panicked.

turns.speaker: JESSIE
turns.text: I was there, you were the only one who didn't panic.  So do everyone a favor, don't hog all the guilt.  You held on as long as you could.  Yes, everything did go wrong, starting with Hal. I mean, what was he doing up on the Tower with a girl who could barely climb?

turns.speaker: GABE
turns.text: I can't blame anything on Hal. It was me.  I play it back in my mind everyday.

turns.speaker: JESSIE
turns.text: Then turn it off, Gabe, because it doesn't get any better.

turns.speaker: GABE
turns.text: I don't expect you to understand.

turns.speaker: JESSIE
turns.text: I don't understand?

turns.speaker: GABE
turns.text: You couldn't.

turns.speaker: JESSIE
turns.text: You're saying, I don't understand?  I'm the <u>only</u> one who does understand.  I'm the one you lived with for two years, I'm the one you made promises to, I'm the one who spent too many nights looking up at these rocks and wondering if you were ever going to make it down in once piece or ever at all.  Believe me, there's been times I didn't know what I wanted to do more, love you or hate you.  But the one thing in our relationship that I did know and still do know is that I <u>understand you</u>.

turns.speaker: GABE
turns.text: Why are you yelling?

turns.speaker: JESSIE
turns.text: Excuse me?

turns.speaker: GABE
turns.text: Why are you yelling?

turns.speaker: JESSIE
turns.text: Did I miss something?

turns.speaker: GABE
turns.text: Y'know, yelling at this altitude can lead to hyperventilation and fainting--

turns.speaker: JESSIE
turns.text: I'm not going to faint, but if I want to faint, I'll faint, okay?

turns.speaker: GABE
turns.text: Okay, but if you do I'll have to perform resuscitation--

turns.speaker: JESSIE
turns.text: Resuscitation?

turns.speaker: GABE
turns.text: --mouth-to-mouth, which could maybe...

turns.speaker: JESSIE
turns.text: Which could maybe what?

turns.speaker: GABE
turns.text: Maybe lead to a flare up...

turns.speaker: JESSIE
turns.text: A flare up...

turns.speaker: GABE
turns.text: Flare up of old emotions...

turns.speaker: JESSIE
turns.text: Listen to you...  The old "mouth-to-mouth" resuscitation routine, huh?

turns.speaker: GABE
turns.text: From one professional to another, of course.

turns.speaker: JESSIE
turns.text: Course maybe you don't have to wait until I faint.

turns.speaker: GABE
turns.text: No, I think I will, it's safer. I have patience.

turns.speaker: JESSIE
turns.text: Gabe, did you come back to stay?  You didn't.

turns.speaker: GABE
turns.text: I can't.  Not here.  If you want, I'd like you to come with me...somewhere else.

turns.speaker: JESSIE
turns.text: Where?

turns.speaker: GABE
turns.text: It doesn't matter, anywhere but here.

turns.speaker: JESSIE
turns.text: You come back after being gone almost a year, and you expect me to just leave...  This was <u>our</u> home, now it's <u>my</u> home.  I can't leave.  You can stay with me, and believe me, I want you to, but to just take off for the wrong reasons, I can't do it.  And you shouldn't either.

turns.speaker: GABE
turns.text: Like I said, I can't turn it off.

turns.speaker: JESSIE
turns.text: And I can't leave.

turns.speaker: GABE
turns.text: If it's alright, I'm gonna pick up the rest of my gear.

turns.speaker: JESSIE
turns.text: You know where everything is...  I'm late for my shift.

turns.speaker: GABE
turns.text: Jess--you look good.

turns.speaker: JESSIE
turns.text: Thank God you didn't leave.  We just got a Mayday.  Seven climbers stranded off Comb Bluff. The weather's pouring in fast and Hal's gone up alone.

turns.speaker: GABE
turns.text: Hal knows what he's doing.

turns.speaker: JESSIE
turns.text: If he gets up there and the weather gets as bad as it can, they'll never make it down.  He needs someone who has emergency medical training and knows every handhold on these peaks.

turns.speaker: GABE
turns.text: He doesn't want my help.

turns.speaker: JESSIE
turns.text: That's not the issue here, those people are.  He can't do it alone.

turns.speaker: GABE
turns.text: He can handle it.

turns.speaker: JESSIE
turns.text: What if he can't?

turns.speaker: GABE
turns.text: I haven't climbed in months--you lose the feel.

turns.speaker: JESSIE
turns.text: You mean the nerve.

turns.speaker: JESSIE
turns.text: I know you don't want to be responsible for anybody's life anymore, but walk away and you are responsible.  Please Gabe, he went up the west ridge.  If you go up the south face, you can catch him, no problem--

turns.speaker: GABE
turns.text: Can't do it.

turns.speaker: JESSIE
turns.text: Can't do it?  I don't believe this.  Don't you feel anything?

turns.speaker: GABE
turns.text: I only came back for you.

turns.speaker: JESSIE
turns.text: Gabe!?

turns.speaker: GABE
turns.text: What are you doing here!?

turns.speaker: JESSIE
turns.text: Looking for Hal.  Oh my God, I heard someone kick the door open...you came back.

turns.speaker: GABE
turns.text: How'd you get up here?

turns.speaker: JESSIE
turns.text: Frank dropped me in the west valley and I hiked.  You look frozen.  What's happening?!

turns.speaker: GABE
turns.text: You got to go back now!

turns.speaker: JESSIE
turns.text: Where's Hal, what's going on?

turns.speaker: GABE
turns.text: Before it crashed, they dumped three cases filled with millions. They're using Hal for a bird dog. Once they find the money, Hal's dead.  So get on your radio, contact Frank, have him pick you up, then contact the state police, the park police and anything else wearing a badge and tell them to get up here!  Do it Jessie.

turns.speaker: JESSIE
turns.text: I can't.  The radio's at the bottom of the shaft.  But Frank'll be looking for me soon. When he gets here I'll contact everybody from the chopper.

turns.speaker: GABE
turns.text: That's no good. It'll be dark soon, there's no other shelter for ten miles. If they show, they'll take you too.  Why'd you have to come up here?!

turns.speaker: JESSIE
turns.text: For the same reason you did, to help.

turns.speaker: GABE
turns.text: Yeah, let's go.

turns.speaker: GABE
turns.text: Let's be creative.

turns.speaker: JESSIE
turns.text: Excuse me?

turns.speaker: GABE
turns.text: They've got to find shelter soon, and so do we.  How are you holding up?

turns.speaker: JESSIE
turns.text: You know me, I'm a night person.

turns.speaker: GABE
turns.text: Take off and meet me at Eagle Cave.

turns.speaker: JESSIE
turns.text: What about you?

turns.speaker: GABE
turns.text: Don't worry about me, just go.

turns.speaker: GABE
turns.text: Man, it costs a fortune to heat this place.

turns.speaker: JESSIE
turns.text: I'm glad you find humor in this.  Do you know what people would do for that?

turns.speaker: GABE
turns.text: I can't believe you just said that.

turns.speaker: JESSIE
turns.text: Neither can I.  What do you think they're doing now?

turns.speaker: GABE
turns.text: Making things real rough for Hal.

turns.speaker: JESSIE
turns.text: You still wear the cable necklace I gave you.

turns.speaker: GABE
turns.text: Call me sentimental.

turns.speaker: JESSIE
turns.text: Remember the first time we came up here?

turns.speaker: GABE
turns.text: Of course I do.

turns.speaker: JESSIE
turns.text: It was great.

turns.speaker: GABE
turns.text: You attacked me.

turns.speaker: JESSIE
turns.text: Can you think of something more romantic than attacked?

turns.speaker: GABE
turns.text: Only kidding...<u>actually</u> I attacked you.

turns.speaker: JESSIE
turns.text: No, actually it was more like mutual attacking.

turns.speaker: JESSIE
turns.text: Why can't things stay the way they are...everything has to change.  What we had was perfect.

turns.speaker: GABE
turns.text: I don't know.  Here, lay down and get some rest.  We're going to need it.

turns.speaker: JESSIE
turns.text: Gabe...your arm?

turns.speaker: GABE
turns.text: Yeah?

turns.speaker: JESSIE
turns.text: If you're not using your arm, can I borrow it?

turns.speaker: GABE
turns.text: Sure, just give it back when you're done.

turns.speaker: GABE
turns.text: We have to get through to the other side.  You up for it?

turns.speaker: JESSIE
turns.text: I've gone this far, and right now I think I'm in better shape than you.

turns.speaker: GABE
turns.text: A simple yes or no would have done.

turns.speaker: JESSIE
turns.text: Want me to lead?

turns.speaker: GABE
turns.text: Cute.
